pull.title: cmake: Generate man pages at install time
pull.body:
This PR enables the man pages to be generated on the fly during installation.

As the GNU help2man tool is required to generate man pages, the `INSTALL_MAN` build option is disabled by default.

Addresses this comment:https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/809d7e763cc9bdfff3288860a1c530460c76ffff/src/CMakeLists.txt#L456

Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31762.

verification.payload:
tree cb6aeeb651d56e14d25c93595f9926e6df2344d8
parent 809d7e763cc9bdfff3288860a1c530460c76ffff
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1738235124 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1738235124 +0000

cmake: Disable `INSTALL_MAN` by default

In subsequent commits, manpages will be generated on the fly, which
requires the `help2man` tool.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31764.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
cc @theuni, as the author of the TODO [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/809d7e763cc9bdfff3288860a1c530460c76ffff/src/CMakeLists.txt#L456).
Do the release process docs need any changes from this?
This approach is not applicable for general cross-compilation scenarios :man_facepalming:
One other side-effect of this change would be that someone cloning a tag would no-longer get the manpages. Maybe this doesn't matter, but would be good to mention.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -545,6 +546,7 @@ inspecting signatures in Mach-O binaries.")
         gcc-toolchain-12
         cmake-minimal
         gnu-make
+        help2man
comments.body: How does this change the guix dep graph?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -453,9 +453,9 @@ install(TARGETS ${installable_targets}
 unset(installable_targets)
 
 if(INSTALL_MAN)
-  # TODO: these stubs are no longer needed. man pages should be generated at install time.
-  install(DIRECTORY ../doc/man/
+  install(CODE "execute_process(COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E make_directory ${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/doc/man)")
+  install(CODE "execute_process(COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E env BUILDDIR=${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR} MANDIR=${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/doc/man ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.py --skip-missing-binaries)")
comments.body:
> --skip-missing-binaries

I don't think we should be hardcoding a flag to ignore/skip errors into a script that you're making a requirement for release builds.
